exercises.description: Step forward into a forward lunge with both feet pointing straight ahead. Slowly lower your back knee toward the floor as you rotate your hips and trunk toward the front leg. Pause briefly at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position while rotating back to neutral.

external_cues: Imagine your pelvis and ribcage stacked like an elevator moving straight down.
Rotate around a vertical axis through the spine rather than leaning.
Keep the front knee tracking over the middle toes.
compensation_warnings: If the front knee collapses inward, reduce depth or rotation.
If your torso tilts sideways, pause and re-establish the upright elevator line.
If your pelvis drifts forward or backward instead of staying stacked, use more support.
safety_flags: Stop if SI discomfort increases with rotation.
Stop if pelvic alignment repeatedly shifts and cannot be corrected.
Stop if the support hand becomes weight-bearing instead of stabilizing.

exercises.description: Stand upright holding a stable support. Keeping the trunk tall and pelvis level, slowly move one leg out to the side without leaning. Pause briefly, then return to the starting position.

external_cues: Imagine a string lifting the top of your head.
Keep your belt line level as the leg moves.
compensation_warnings: Do not lean the trunk to the side.
Do not hike the pelvis on the moving leg.
safety_flags: Stop if hip or low back pain increases.

exercises.description: Stand on one leg with the pelvis level and trunk upright. Maintain balance without letting the foot collapse or the body sway excessively.

external_cues: Imagine rooting the foot into the ground.
Keep the pelvis level like a bowl of water.
compensation_warnings: Do not let the arch collapse.
Avoid locking the knee.

exercises.description: Sit upright with feet flat on the floor. Lift one knee toward the chest while maintaining an upright trunk. Lower the foot and alternate sides.

external_cues: Sit tall with weight evenly distributed on both sit bones.
compensation_warnings: Do not lean backward.
Avoid shrugging the shoulders.
safety_flags: Stop if low back discomfort increases.

exercises.description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Gently lift the hips toward the ceiling while keeping the ribcage down. Lower slowly back to the starting position.

external_cues: Imagine rolling the spine up one segment at a time.
compensation_warnings: Do not arch the low back at the top.
Avoid pushing through the neck.

exercises.description: Stand on the edge of a step with both feet, holding a stable support. Allow the heels to lower below the level of the step until a stretch is felt in the calves. The stretch depth is determined by how far the heels drop relative to the step surface. Hold the position without bouncing.

external_cues: Keep both heels aligned and moving straight down off the step.
Keep knees straight but not locked.
Keep weight evenly distributed across both feet.
compensation_warnings: Do not arch or round the low back.
Do not bend the knees to increase the stretch.
Avoid shifting weight to one side.
safety_flags: Use a stable support surface at all times.
Stop if sharp pain occurs in the ankle, knee, or low back.

exercises.description: Stand with one foot in front of the other, aligning the heel of the front foot toward the toes of the back foot without full contact. The stance difficulty is determined by the distance between the front heel and back toes. Hold the position without stepping or shifting foot placement.

external_cues: Keep hips level as the body makes small adjustments.
Keep shoulders stacked over hips as balance shifts.
compensation_warnings: Do not hinge forward at the hips.
Do not rotate through the pelvis or low back.
Avoid gripping the toes or locking the knees.
safety_flags: Perform near a wall or stable surface.
Stop if dizziness, nausea, or loss of balance occurs.

exercises.description: While standing, lift the forefoot slightly off the ground and place a ball against the outside of the foot. Press the outside of the foot into the ball without allowing ankle rolling or body movement. Perform on one foot at a time and hold the contraction.

external_cues: Lift the forefoot off the ground before pressing.
Keep the heel planted.
Press the outside of the foot straight into the ball without rolling the ankle.
compensation_warnings: Do not let the knee collapse inward or outward.
Do not twist the pelvis or trunk.
Avoid using the hip or back to generate force.
safety_flags: Discontinue if knee pain or ankle pain increases.
Perform seated if standing causes knee irritation.

exercises.description: While seated, place both feet flat on the floor. Keeping the heels in contact with the ground, rotate the feet outward from the ankles and return to neutral. Movement should occur at the ankles without motion from the knees, hips, or trunk.

external_cues: Keep heels fully in contact with the floor.
Rotate feet from the ankles, not the knees or hips.
Keep knees facing straight forward.
compensation_warnings: Do not let knees fall inward or outward.
Do not rotate through the hips or low back.
Avoid leaning the trunk or shifting weight.
safety_flags: Stop if low back or SI joint pain increases.
